entry.title: The Public Telecommunication System Designation (Atlantic Telecommunications Limited) Order 1997
entry.summary: The Secretary of State granted to Atlantic Telecommunications Limited a licence on 6 June 1997 under section 7 of the Telecommunications Act 1984 to run the telecommunication systems specified in that Licence in the East of Scotland, including the Grampian, Tayside, Central and Lothian regions. A copy of the licence was laid before Parliament on 24th November 1997. This Order designates those telecommunication systems as public telecommunication systems. Consequently, by virtue of section 9(3) of that Act, Atlantic Telecommunications Limited will be a public telecommunications operator in respect of the telecommunication systems run under that licence when this Order comes into force on 23rd December 1997.

entry.title: The Sole, Plaice, etc (Specified Sea Areas) (Prohibition of Fishing) Order 1997
The Education (Schools) Act 1997 (Commencement) Order 1997
The Local Government and Rating Act 1997 (Commencement No. 2) Order 1997
The Local Government Act 1988 (Defined Activities) (Exemptions) (Amendment) Order 1997
The Education (Assisted Places) (Scotland) Amendment (No.2) Regulations 1997
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (Assisted Places) (Scotland) Regulations 1995 in light of provisions introduced by the Education (Schools) Act 1997 to phase out the Assisted Places Scheme. Under these new provisions, no pupils will be admitted to the Scheme after the start of the school session 1997/98. The amendment made by these Regulations enables the Secretary of State to authorise a replacement school to provide an assisted place for an existing assisted pupil whose school merges with another school, closes or no longer wishes to participate in the Scheme.

entry.title: The Local Government (Direct Labour Organisations) (Competition) (Amendment) Regulations 1997
The Nottinghamshire Fire Services (Combination Scheme) Order 1997
entry.summary: This Order makes a scheme which combines the areas of the council of the city of Nottingham (which would otherwise become an individual fire authority on 1st April 1998 by virtue of the Local Government Act 1992) and the Nottinghamshire County Council into a combined fire area. The scheme comes into force on the same day as the Order comes into force for the purpose of doing anything which is necessary to bring the scheme fully into operation on 1st April 1998. The scheme establishes a fire authority for the combined area, to be known as the Nottinghamshire and City of Nottingham Fire Authority, and provides for the appointment and terms of office of its members, and for meetings of the Authority. The scheme establishes a fire brigade for the combined area, to be known as the Nottinghamshire Fire and Rescue Service or by such other name as the Authority determines, appoints its first chief officer, and provides for the submission of an establishment scheme to the Secretary of State. The scheme establishes a combined fire service fund and provides for the administration of the Authorityâ€™s finances. The scheme also provides for the transfer of staff, and certain property, rights and liabilities, directly from the Nottingham County Council (the fire authority for the same area as the combined area prior to 1st April 1998) to the new combined authority.

entry.title: The Value Added Tax (Drugs, Medicines and Aids for the Handicapped) Order 1997
entry.summary: This Order, which comes into force on 1st January 1998, amends Group 12 of Schedule 8 to the Value Added Tax Act 1994.

entry.title: The Local Government Act 1988 (Competition) (Revocations) Regulations 1997
The Lancashire Fire Services (Combination Scheme) Order 1997
entry.summary: This Order makes a scheme which combines the areas of the councils of the boroughs of Blackburn with Darwen and Blackpool (which would otherwise become individual fire authorities on 1st April 1998 by virtue of the Local Government Act 1992) and the Lancashire County Council into a combined fire area. The scheme comes into force on the same day as the Order comes into force for the purpose of doing anything which is necessary to bring the scheme fully into operation on 1st April 1998. The scheme establishes a fire authority for the combined area, to be known as the Lancashire Combined Fire Authority, and provides for the appointment and terms of office of its members, and for meetings of the Authority. The scheme establishes a fire brigade for the combined area, to be known as the Lancashire Fire Brigade or by such other name as the Authority determines, appoints its first chief officer, and provides for the submission of an establishment scheme to the Secretary of State. The scheme establishes a combined fire service fund and provides for the administration of the Authorityâ€™s finances. The scheme also provides for the transfer of staff, and certain property, rights and liabilities, directly from the Lancashire County Council (the fire authority for the same area as the combined area prior to 1st April 1998) to the new combined authority.

The Mink (Keeping) (Amendment) Regulations 1997
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Mink (Keeping) Regulations 1975 (as amended) in respect of the fees prescribed in respect of licences to keep mink, with effect from 1st January 1998. In the case of a special licence to keep mink for exhibition or for purposes of scientific research or other exceptional purposes, granted under section 8 of the Destructive Imported Animals Act 1932 (â€œthe Actâ€), they prescribe a fee of Â£185 in England and Wales, and Â£60 in Scotland. In the case of a licence granted under section 3 of the Act (all other cases in which a licence is granted), they prescribe a fee of Â£630.

entry.title: The Taxes (Interest Rate) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations 1997
The Coypus (Special Licence) (Fees) Regulations 1997
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the fee to be charged in respect of the grant of a special licence under section 8 of the Destructive Imported Animals Act 1932 (â€œthe Actâ€) authorising the licensee to keep coypus for exhibition, purposes of scientific research or other exceptional purposes. The fee prescribed in England and Wales is Â£185, and in Scotland Â£60. The keeping of coypus otherwise than in accordance with a licence granted under section 8 of the Act is prohibited by the Coypus (Prohibition on Keeping) Order 1987 (S.I. 1987/2195).
